data.title: Wieting Family Funeral Home
data.meta_description: George W. Bauer, age 84, of Stockbridge, entered the kingdom of heaven on Mon. Jan. 23, 2006. He passed peacefully at home with his family at his side. He was born on May 6, 1921, son of Theodore and Mildred ""Alice"" (Hailey) Bauer. George served in the U.S. Army during WWII, and was awarded the Purple Heart during his service to our country. God blessed George with the talent
data.text:
Hold this candle for me so I can see you on my way home. I hope too see all the bauer family soon.

Posted by Roy W Bauer - Little Suamico, WI - Son December 30, 2011

Miss you dad, I hope every thing is going ok up there in Heaven. i hope to see you some day soon.

Posted by Roy W Bauer - Little Suamico, WI - Son December 30, 2011

" he's still in our memories till the end and will keep on going." i love you little grandpa

Posted by bauer family - houston , TX April 30, 2011

we miss him more everyday,his smile&his laughter. since his passing the flowers dont bloom and the birds dont sing their sweet song at his window.but we know that where he is now the flowers grow stronger and the birds sing much sweetter.what a paradise it is.

Posted by allard family January 18, 2009

We both worked with George for many years at Hewitt Machine Company. Tom says he was a great boss to work for and respected his knowledge. He enjoyed it very much.

Posted by Tom & Dawn Peeters January 27, 2006

My condolences to the Bauer family. George was a wonderful, beautiful man. One who always had a space in his heart for everyone. If anyone deserves a place in heaven its George. My thoughts and prayers for all of you. God Bless.

Posted by Debbie Mueller Franz January 26, 2006

I would like to extend my condolences to Darlene and all the family.

George was a great machinist and did an outstanding job for many years. He was a dedicated employee. Often he'd come into work in the middle of the night if there was ever a break-down and then work his own shift after that!

He will be missed.

God Bless, Tim Hewitt

Posted by Tim Hewitt January 25, 2006

Our condolences to the Bauer family.

From Westley Bauer's friends and co-workers at Lindsey Electric in Houston, Texas.

Posted by Lindsey Electric January 25, 2006

I worked with George for many years at Hewitt Machine, and was continually amazed at the talent and passion he had for his job and his skills. I am unable to attend his services due to medical tests, but he will be in my prayers. Jim Lyons

Posted by Jim Lyons January 25, 2006

Wieting Family Funeral Home () 2015-05-28 10:58:59
